example.name: just transitive
example.text: Sales dropped to $441.1 million from $820.4 million, because the company no longer consolidates its Eastern Steel division, which is now a joint venture with Kawasaki Steel Corp.
example.arg: its Eastern Steel division, which is now a joint venture with Kawasaki Steel Corp

example.name: with ground and source
example.text: Next year [Western Digital]-1 plans *trace*-1 to consolidate its operations from 11 buildings in Irvine into two buildings in the same city, a new headquarters and, a block away, a modern $100 million silicon wafer fabrication plant.
example.arg: into two buildings in the same city, a new headquarters and, a block away, a modern $100 million silicon wafer fabrication plant

predicate.note: Frames file for 'consolidate' based on sentences in financial subcorpus. Verbnet entry amalgamate-22.2, other framed members include confuse, engage, incorporate, integrate, introduce, oppose and wed. Comparison with 'integrate'.
